headline: Chevron Reenters Libya And Expands Venezuela Footprint As Valuation Question Persists
summary: Chevron (NYSE:CVX) has reentered Libya for the first time in 15 years with new exploration licenses in the Sirte Basin. The company is expanding operations in Venezuela after U.S. sanctions were eased and broader operational rights were granted. These moves follow international policy changes that reopened access to two oil rich regions that were previously restricted for many global majors. For investors watching NYSE:CVX, these developments highlight how policy shifts can open new...
